physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Chest radiography showed bilateral hilar interstitial infiltrates. Cardiac failure was noted.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Worsening cardiac and renal function led to transfer to the cardiac critical care unit.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Rales throughout right mid- to lower-lung fields detected on examination.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Condition deteriorated, leading to admission to the intensive care unit due to acute hypoxemia.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Chest radiography showed bilateral hilar infiltrates. Blood counts, serum electrolytes, and renal and liver function remained normal.
Stable vital signs were reported. Blood-gas evaluations showed satisfactory oxygen levels while breathing ambient air.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Normal results on serum electrolytes and renal and liver function. No subsequent deterioration reported.
